org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render
Class XYRenderer

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.render.XYRenderer
Direct Known Subclasses:
BarChartXYRenderer, XYLineRenderer
public abstract class XYRenderer
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class used classes which render a curve using data

Constructor Summary
XYRenderer()
           
 
Method Summary
abstract  void beginCurve(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, boolean inSelection, boolean disabled)
          Called before first data is plotted, typically drawing state is setup, or a path is begun
abstract  void beginPoints(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, boolean inSelection, boolean disabled)
          Called before points are plotted, typically to setup drawing state (colors, etc)
abstract  void drawCurvePart(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, double dataX, double dataY, int seriesNum, boolean isFocused, boolean isHovered, boolean inSelection, boolean isDisabled)
          Called for each visible data point, typically a segment is added to the current drawing path, unless a more sophisticated shape like a bar chart is being rendered
abstract  Bounds drawLegendIcon(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, double x, double y, int seriesNum)
          Render a small icon or sparkline representing this curve at the given x,y screen coordinates, and return the the Bounds of the icon
abstract  void drawPoint(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, double domainx, double rangey, int seriesNum, boolean focused, boolean hovered, boolean inSelection, boolean disabled)
          Draw an individual point of the given domain and range values
abstract  void endCurve(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, boolean inSelection, boolean disabled, int seriesNum)
          Called after last data is plotted (last call to drawCurvePart), typically when stroke() or fill() is invoked
abstract  void endPoints(XYPlot plot, Layer layer, boolean inSelection, boolean disabled, int seriesNum)
          Called after all points are plotted, typically to cleanup state (restore() after a save() )
 int getMaxDrawableDatapoints(XYPlot plot)
          The maximum number of datapoints that should be drawn in the view and maintain interactive framerates for this renderer
